definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: Worrying and dwelling on one’s worries is a surefire way of building up paranoia.
sentences.chinese: 焦慮和停留在某人的煩惱上面是一定會造成偏執狂的。

sentences.english: Paranoid Here is a commendatory term, not to mention the fact that this is the case.
sentences.chinese: 偏執狂在這裏就是褒義詞，何況事實的確如此。

sentences.english: I already said and repeated, that it is an obsessional phantasy.
sentences.chinese: 我已經說過，也一再重複，這是偏執狂的幻見。

sentences.english: Monomania is a prerequisite of success.
sentences.chinese: 成功的第一步即是成爲偏執狂。

sentences.english: Japan is also known for its paranoia of foreign diseases.
sentences.chinese: 日本衆所周知是一個猜疑外國疾病的偏執狂。

sentences.english: A bigot is a stone-leaf orator.
sentences.chinese: 偏執狂是極聾的演說家。

sentences.english: They capitalize on panic and paranoia.
sentences.chinese: 他們利用恐慌和偏執狂。

sentences.english: Bobby: Wow, I guess prejudice is cloaked in black robes sometimes too.
sentences.chinese: 哇，原來法官有時也是一個披着黑袍偏執狂。

definition: to be absent-minded/to desert/to abscond from the army/absent without leave (AWOL)
crow's beak/(fig.) person who makes an inauspicious remark
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
